title: Sophie Turner to play Lara Croft in new 'Tomb Raider' series
description: "I am thrilled beyond measure to be playing Lara Croft," Turner said.
content:

Yahoo is using AI to generate takeaways from this article. This means the info may not always match what's in the article. Reporting mistakes helps us improve the experience. Generate Key Takeaways

Actress Sophie Turner is set to play Lara Croft in a new "Tomb Raider" series.

Amazon MGM Studios confirmed the casting news in an Wednesday. The Tomb Raider video game franchise shared the news on its page as well.

"I am thrilled beyond measure to be playing Lara Croft," Turner said in a . "She's such an iconic character, who means so much to so many -- and I am giving everything I've got."

Phoebe Waller-Bridge will write and executive produce the new "Tomb Raider" series, which was announced last May at Amazon MGM Studios' upfronts presentation.

"They're massive shoes to fill, following in the steps of Angelina and Alicia with their powerhouse performances, but with Phoebe at the helm, we (and Lara) are all in very safe hands," Turner continued in her statement. "I can't wait for you all to see what we have cooking."

Waller-Bridge added in her own statement, "It's not very often you get to make a show of this scale with a character you grew up loving. Everyone on board is wildly passionate about Lara and are all as outrageous, brave, and hilarious as she is. Get your artifacts out... Croft is coming...."

The new "Tomb Raider" series is based on the action and adventure video game franchise of the same name from game developer Core Design. The first game in the franchise was released in 1996, with multiple sequel installments and spinoffs in the years since.

The game centers around fictional British archaeologist Lara Croft, who travels the world in search of ancient artifacts, encountering dangerous situations and hostile enemies in the process.

keywords.name: The Tomb Raider video game franchise

summary: Actress Sophie Turner is set to play Lara Croft in a new "Tomb Raider" series. The series is based on the action and adventure video game franchise of the same name from Core Design and will be written and executive produced by Phoebe Waller-Bridge. shortSummary: Sophie Turner will play Lara Croft in Amazon's new Tomb Raider series, written and directed by Phoebe Waller-Bridge, following her predecessor's departure from The Avengers: Infinity Review.

scraped_sources.text:
Sep 3, 2025
Sophie Turner confirmed as Lara Croft in upcoming Prime Video new series Tomb Raider.
Phoebe Waller-Bridge serves as creator, writer, executive producer, and co-showrunner.
Jonathan Van Tulleken will serve as director and executive producer and Chad Hodge joins as co-showrunner.
Amazon MGM Studios confirms January 19th, 2026 as the start of production for the live-action adaptation of Tomb Raider.
Sophie Turner, who has been cast in the role of Lara Croft, had this to say: “I am thrilled beyond measure to be playing Lara Croft. She’s such an iconic character, who means so much to so many - and I am giving everything I’ve got. They’re massive shoes to fill, following in the steps of Angelina and Alicia with their powerhouse performances, but with Phoebe at the helm, we (and Lara) are all in very safe hands. I can’t wait for you all to see what we have cooking.”
Phoebe Waller-Bridge (Fleabag, Killing Eve) serves as writer, executive producer and co-showrunner: “I’m so excited to announce the formidable Sophie Turner as our Lara alongside this phenomenal creative team. It’s not very often you get to make a show of this scale with a character you grew up loving. Everyone on board is wildly passionate about Lara and are all as outrageous, brave, and hilarious as she is. Get your artifacts out... Croft is coming...”
Vernon Sanders, Head of Global Television, Prime Video & Amazon MGM Studios: “Lara Croft is one of the most recognizable and iconic video game characters of all time. We are thrilled to have the wonderfully talented Sophie Turner bring this character to life who is defined by her courage, strength, and unshakable resolve. Led by the brilliant Phoebe Waller-Bridge, this series will honor the beloved Tomb Raider legacy while delivering fresh adventures to fans worldwide.”
Prime Video also confirms Jonathan Van Tulleken as director and executive producer, with Chad Hodge joining as co-showrunner.
Tomb Raider the series is based on the iconic Tomb Raider video game franchise, which follows the adventures of world-famous archaeologist and adventurer Lara Croft.
The series is executive produced by Crystal Dynamics; Phoebe Waller-Bridge and Jenny Robins through Wells Street Productions; Dmitri M. Johnson, Mike Goldberg and Timothy I. Stevenson through Story Kitchen; Michael Scheel; and Legendary Television.
The series is produced by Story Kitchen, Crystal Dynamics and Amazon MGM Studios.
Waller-Bridge is represented by UTA, Independent Talent, McEwan & Penford, and Johnson Shapiro Slewett & Kole.
Sophie Turner's representation includes Creative Artists Agency (CAA), Independent Talent Group, and Public Eye Communications.
Chad Hodge is represented by WME, Cullen Conly at Anonymous Content, and Dean Bahat at Ziffren, Brittenham.
Jonathan Van Tulleken is represented by WME, Untitled, and Independent Talent.
Story Kitchen is represented by WME & Pryor Cashman.
Sign up to join our Society of Raiders and receive monthly newsletters & exclusive rewards. Adventure is calling!
Sign Up

'Tomb Raider' series announced from Phoebe Waller-Bridge
Phoebe Waller-Bridge is set to write and executive produce a new "Tomb Raider" series.
Amazon's Prime Video announced at its inaugural upfront presentation on May 14 that Lara Croft, the world-famous archaeologist and adventurer who has inspired fans in video games and feature films, is getting her own show.
"If I could tell my teenage self this was happening I think she'd explode," Waller-Bridge said in a statement. "'Tomb Raider' has been a huge part of my life and I feel incredibly privileged to be bringing it to television with such passionate collaborators."
The "Indiana Jones and the Dial of Destiny" actress and "Fleabag" creator added, "Lara Croft means a lot to me, as she does to many, and I can't wait to go on this adventure. Bats 'n all."
Crystal Dynamics -- the studio behind the recent "Tomb Raider" video game trilogy reboot -- and Amazon MGM Studio are producing the series.
No further details about the cast, including who will play Lara Croft, or a premiere date were shared in the announcement.

argos_summary: Sophie Turner has been cast as Lara Croft in a new Amazon Prime Video Tomb Raider series, with Phoebe Waller‑Bridge as writer and executive producer. Production is slated to begin January 19, 2026, and the show aims to bring the iconic video‑game character to television. Turner expressed excitement about the role, while Waller‑Bridge praised the team's passion for the franchise.
